Class MathUtil

java.lang.Object
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.util.MathUtil
public final class MathUtil extends Object
Utility class for mathematical operations.

    • floor

      public static int floor(double value)
      Returns the largest integer value that is less than or equal to the argument.

      See Math.floor(double).

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the largest integer value that is less than or equal to the argument.

    • round

      public static int round(double value)
      Returns the closest integer to the argument. The result is rounded to an integer if the argument is not already an integer.

      See Math.round(double).

      Parameters:
      value - the value to round to the nearest integer.
      Returns:
      the closest integer to the argument.

      Returns the smallest integer value that is greater than or equal to the argument.

      See Math.ceil(double).

      Parameters:
      value - The value to round up to the nearest integer.
      Returns:
      The smallest integer value that is greater than or equal to the argument.

    • clamp

      public static double clamp(double val, double minVal, double maxVal)
      Clamps a value between minimum and maximum values.
      Parameters:
      val - The value to clamp.
      minVal - The lower bound value of the range to which the value should be clamped.
      maxVal - The upper bound value of the range to which the value should be clamped.
      Returns:
      The input value if it is less than the maximum value and more than the minimum value, or the minimum or maximum values if it exceeds either of those.

    • clamp

      public static int clamp(int val, int minVal, int maxVal)
      Clamps a value between minimum and maximum values.
      Parameters:
      val - The value to clamp.
      minVal - The lower bound value of the range to which the value should be clamped.
      maxVal - The upper bound value of the range to which the value should be clamped.
      Returns:
      The input value if it is less than the maximum value and more than the minimum value, or the minimum or maximum values if it exceeds either of those.

    • clampAngleRad

      public static double clampAngleRad(double angle)
      Clamp an angle to [-2PI ; 2PI].
      Parameters:
      angle - The current angle in radians.
      Returns:
      The angle (in radians) clamped to [-2PI ; 2PI].

    • isNumerical

      public static boolean isNumerical(@Nullable @Nullable String str)
      Checks if a string is numerical integer with radix 10.

      Any string for which this method returns false will always throw a NumberFormatException when parsed by Integer.parseInt(String).

      Conversely, any string for which this method returns true may still throw a NumberFormatException when parsed by Integer.parseInt(String) if the number is too large.

      Parameters:
      str - The string to check.
      Returns:
      True if the string is numerical.

    • between

      public static boolean between(int test, int low, int high)
      Check if a given value is between two other values. Matches inclusively.
      Parameters:
      test - Value to be compared.
      low - Minimum value.
      high - Maximum value.
      Returns:
      True if the value is in the provided range or if it equals the low and/or the high value.

    • between

      public static boolean between(double test, double low, double high)
      Check if a given value is between two other values. Matches inclusively.
      Parameters:
      test - Value to be compared.
      low - Minimum value.
      high - Maximum value.
      Returns:
      True if the value is in the provided range or if it equals the low and/or the high value.
